abstract: Reactrix, which makes interactive advertising displays projected on shopping mall floors, said it closed a $45 million Series D funding round, led by D.E. Shaw Group and Menlo Ventures, both new investors. The funding will go toward expanding its network of malls and theaters and developing new technology, the company said.
lead_paragraph: Reactrix, which makes interactive advertising displays projected on shopping mall floors, said it closed a $45 million Series D funding round, led by D.E. Shaw Group and Menlo Ventures, both new investors. The funding will go toward expanding its network of malls and theaters and developing new technology, the company said.

headline.main: VC’s Light Up Reactrix With $45 Million
